title: A Step-by-Step Guide to Uninstalling Valorant

steps.title: Navigate to your System Tray.
steps.content: Navigate to your System Tray. It's in the taskbar and you can usually find it by clicking the caret "^" in the bottom right corner of the tray. If you try uninstalling Valorant without disabling and getting rid of Vanguard first, you'll get an error message and the uninstall will fail.

steps.title: Right-click the Vanguard icon.
steps.content: Right-click the Vanguard icon. You'll see this as a red icon. [1] X Research source A menu will pop-up next to your cursor.

steps.title: Select Exit Vanguard.
steps.content: Select Exit Vanguard . Click Yes to confirm your action. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open "Add or Remove programs" in Settings.
steps.content: Open "Add or Remove programs" in Settings. You can do this by tapping the Win key, then typing Add or remove programs , and selecting the app result or you can open Settings, and click Apps . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Vanguard or Valorant on the list.
steps.content: Click Vanguard or Valorant on the list. Remember they might be prefixed with "Riot," so searching specifically in the "V" section may not help. [4] X Research source When you left-click an item in the list, more options will drop down.

steps.title: Click Uninstall.
steps.content: Click Uninstall . You'll see this option in the bottom right corner of the highlighted app. You may need to select Uninstall again to complete the process. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Open Command Prompt as an administrator.
steps.content: Open Command Prompt as an administrator. To do this, open the Start menu or press the Win key and type CMD . [6] X Research source Right-click the result in the Start menu and select Run as administrator .

steps.title: Enter the following code:
steps.content: Enter the following code: sc delete vgc and press Enter on your keyboard. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Enter the following code:
steps.content: Enter the following code: sc delete vgk and press Enter on your keyboard. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Restart your computer.
steps.content: Restart your computer. You want to ensure the changes take effect, so power your computer off, then turn it back on again. [9] X Research source Top do this, select Restart in the Power menu to reboot your system.

steps.title: Open File Explorer.
steps.content: Open File Explorer. After your computer reboots, you can delete the Vanguard folder. If you don't restart your computer, you'll get an error and will be unable to delete it.

steps.title: Navigate to "C:
steps.content: Navigate to "C: \PROGRAM FILES\". If you don't know how to get there, go to This PC > Local Disk > Program Files." [10] X Research source

steps.title: Right-click "Riot Vanguard" and select Delete.
steps.content: Right-click "Riot Vanguard" and select Delete . You can also drag and drop the file into the recycling bin. [11] X Research source
